name: Titanium.UI.OptionDialog
summary: An option dialog is a modal view that includes a message and one or more option items positioned in the middle of the display on Android and at the bottom edge on iOS. On Android, buttons may be added below the options.

events.name: click
events.summary: Fired when an option of this dialog is clicked or, under certain circumstances, when this dialog is dismissed.
events.description: On iOS as of Release 2.0, when the dialog is dismissed without using an option, for example, using the hide method (iPhone, iPad) or a tap outside of the dialog (iPad), this event is fired as though the cancel option was selected. In these circumstances, the index property will be the cancel option index if defined or -1 otherwise.

properties.name: index
properties.summary: Index of the option that was pressed. See description for result of the dialog being dismissed in some other way.

properties.name: button
properties.summary: Indicates whether the index returned by the index property relates to a button rather than an option item.

properties.name: cancel
properties.summary:
Boolean type on Android; Number on iOS.

On Android, indicates whether the cancel button was clicked, in which case returns true.

On iOS, the value of the cancel property is returned, if defined, or -1 otherwise.

properties.name: destructive
properties.summary: Index of the destructive option if defined or -1 otherwise.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

methods.name: hide
methods.description: This triggers a click event as if cancel was invoked.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Argument containing parameters for this method. Only used on iOS.

methods.name: show
methods.description: On iPad, this dialog is shown in the middle of the display or, when specified via the params argument, as a popover-like dialog attached to another view or control.

parameters.name: params
parameters.summary: Argument containing parameters for this method. Only used on iPad.

properties.name: androidView
properties.summary: View to load inside the message area, to create a custom layout.
properties.description:
On Android you can either define a custom view with this property, or you can assign a set of options to the options property, but not both. If you do, the custom view will appear but not the options you defined.

In an Alloy application you can specify this property with either an <AndroidView/> or <View/> element inside the <OptionDialog/> element, for example:

<Alloy>
    <OptionDialog id="dialog" title="Delete File?" onClick="clickCB">

        <!-- Add View or AndroidView for the androidView property -->
        <AndroidView platform="android" layout="vertical">
            <Label color="red" text="Warning!  This change is permanent and you cannot undo it!" />
        </AndroidView>

        <ButtonNames>
            <ButtonName>Confirm</ButtonName>
            <ButtonName>Cancel</ButtonName>
        </ButtonNames>
    </OptionDialog>
</Alloy>

properties.name: buttonNames
properties.description: This property creates buttons underneath the picker options. The dialog only supports up to three buttons.

properties.name: cancel
properties.description:
On iOS, set to -1 to disable the cancel option.

On iPad, the cancel option must be set to either -1 or the index of the last option. For example, if there are 3 options and one of them is a cancel button, the cancel button must be the last option (index 2). If cancel is set to a different value, the last entry in the options array is not displayed.

Note that the cancel button is never shown on iPad, since the user can cancel the dialog by clicking outside of the dialog.

properties.name: destructive
properties.summary: Index to define the destructive option, indicated by a visual cue when rendered.

properties.name: opaquebackground
properties.summary: Boolean value indicating if the option dialog should have an opaque background.
properties.description: This property is useful to ensure that the option dialog will display contents properly on the iPAD idiom without ghosting when scrolling. This property is only respected on the iPAD idiom on iOS7 and above.

properties.name: options
properties.summary: List of option names to display in the dialog.
properties.description: On Android you can assign a set of options to the OptionDialog with this property, or assign a custom view to the androidView property, but not both. If you do, the custom view will appear but not the options you defined.

properties.name: persistent
properties.summary: Boolean value indicating if the option dialog should only be cancelled by user gesture or by hide method.
properties.description: This property is useful to ensure that the option dialog will not be ignored by the user when the application is paused/suspended.

properties.name: selectedIndex
properties.summary: Defines the default selected option. Since 8.1.0, if not defined or -1 it will show a normal list instead of radio buttons.

properties.name: titleid
properties.summary: Key identifying a string in the locale file to use for the title text.
